issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: HDFS-2653 added negative caching of local addrs, however it still goes through the fall through path every time if the address is non-local.
fields.summary: Negative caching of local addrs doesn't work

comments.body: Patch attached. Verified via logging that we also take the short-cut if a non-local addr is used.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12515900/hdfs-3008.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    -1 javac.  The patch appears to cause tar ant target to fail.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to cause Findbugs (version 1.3.9) to fail.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed the unit tests build

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/1902//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/1902//console

This message is automatically generated.
Thanks Suresh. Had to make a minor update to the patch, put parens around the ternary expression, which apparently is required by some compilers (worked in eclipse).
Thanks for the review Suresh. I've committed this and merged to branch-23 and branch-1.

Hi Eli,

Thanks for fixing this.

For merging to other branches, I think it is better to merge the specific project.  In this case, we should merge only hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs since all the changes are under it.  Otherwise, it will generate unnecessary merge info like below.  What do you think?

{noformat}
Author: eli
Date: Fri Feb 24 21:16:57 2012
New Revision: 1293421

URL: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1293421&view=rev
Log:
HDFS-3008. svn merge -c 1293419 from trunk

Modified:
    hadoop/common/branches/branch-0.23/hadoop-mapreduce-project/  (props changed)
    hadoop/common/branches/branch-0.23/hadoop-mapreduce-project/CHANGES.txt  (props changed)
    hadoop/common/branches/branch-0.23/hadoop-mapreduce-project/bin/  (props changed)
    ...
{noformat}
